page.title: 20LOCAL ORGANISATIONS
page.content: Those who attend a religious service have to go out of the area for{worship e.g.to St. Oswald's Church Worleston, Poole Methodist Chapel or the Christ- adelphian meeting place in Nantwich. {Local social events}e.g.Whist drives and dances,are held in{Worleston {Village Hall}and the management committee includes people from Aston- J-Mondrum{Worleston Women's Institute, {Worleston Conservative Association & {Worleston Cub & Scout groups}also attract the support of people from the area.Families are also able to attend an{All-age club}held monthly in the Village Hall. A free{monthly {newsletter}is written by two Worleston residents and circulated to all households. Immediate local concerns e.g.fotpaths are looked after by {Worleston and District Parish Council.
